item.description:
Come join us for a hike and picnic (this is the middle day of the 3-day Columbus Day Holiday).  Here is the link for directions:

http://www.agamenticus.org/

Just click on view more photos in the gallery for additional pictures.

Hike is easy to moderate.  Elevation gain is about 400 feet over 1.2 miles.  Top is 692 feet - not that  high, but the tallest point for many miles around, so there are great views.  Can see Mt. Washington on a really clear day!

After that we'll head to a nearby pond for a picnic.

The loop to the top of Mount A and back is about 2.5 miles.  Estimate another mile each way back and forth from where we will have our picnic.  So that's about 4 - 5 miles; total time should be less than 3 hours unless we decide to make it a longer hike, which if it's cool and colorful, we might choose to do.

Picnic lunch, beverages, and boots or shoes with grips on the bottom to avoid slipping on pebbles or wet rocks are recommended.

We'll meet at edge of base parking lot in the shady area in back of large boulders.  Let me know if you need assistance with the directions.

As with all Meetups, this hike is at Members' risk.

Look forward to meeting everybody!
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet at edge of base parking lot in the shady area in back of large boulders.
item.name: Hike and picnic at Mount Agamenticus!
